intro: Thlaspi aileeniae, commonly known as the Armenian cabbageweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous species. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has a rosette of basal leaves. It is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats. Thlaspi aileeniae is characterized by its tolerance to harsh environmental conditions.
